activities:
Study participants have the choice to opt-out of having personal information disclosed to a third party through the research consent process.
MNI's use of personal information is limited to the purposes for which it is collected.  MNI takes reasonable steps to ensure that data is relevant to its intended use, accurate, complete and current.
MNI obtains assurances from its agents (employees) that they will safeguard personal information consistently with its Data Protection Policy.
Upon request, research participants are granted reasonable access to their personal information held by MNI, and MNI will take reasonable steps to permit individuals to correct, amend, or delete information that is demonstrated to be inaccurate or incomplete.
MNI will take reasonable precautions to protect personal information in its possession from loss, misuse and unauthorized access, disclosure, alertation, and destruction.
MNI conducts compliance audits of its relevant privacy practices to verify adherence to its Policy.
contacttitle1: Sr. Director of Regulatory Affairs & QA
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Czech Republic, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
recoursemech: If after investigation and attempt for resolution a complaint remains unresolved between MNI and the complainant, MNI agrees to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by European data protection authorities (DPAs) to resolve disputes to the Safe Harbor.
